Cost IPTp

cost_iptp.Rd

Cost IPTp

Usage

cost_iptp(n_administrations, iptp_cost_per_administration = 0.79)

Arguments

n_administrations

Number of IPTp doses

iptp_cost_per_administration

Cost per dose delivered

Value

IPTp costs

References

Dosing information

Starting as early as possible in the second trimester, IPTp-SP is recommended for all pregnant women at each scheduled antenatal care (ANC) visit until the time of delivery, provided that the doses are given at least one month apart.

IPTp-SP should ideally be administered as directly observed therapy (DOT) of three tablets sulfadoxine/pyrimethamine (each tablet containing500 mg/25 mg SP) giving the total required dosage of 1500 mg/75 mg SP.

https://www.who.int/publications-detail-redirect/WHO-HTM-GMP-2014.4

IPTp_cost_per_dose_delivered

Current default is the total cost per administration of IPTp-SP (health care worker time and commodity cost) with sulfadoxine–pyrimethamine. Costs are in 2012 USD$.

Fernandes et al (2016). Table 2.

https://malariajournal.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12936-016-1539-4
